questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams and contains the resources shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You need to configure the subscription to meet the following requirements:

• App1 must be pinned only to the Teams desktop client of the users in Group1.
• App2 must be pinned only to the Teams desktop client of the users in Group2.

What should you do in the Microsoft Teams admin center?

choices.C: Modify the global (Org-wide default) app permission policy.
choices.D: Modify the global (Org-wide default) app setup policy.

discussion.content: App setup policies for pinning apps.
Create individual App Setup Policies
Answer is correct.

1. **Users in the R&D department will not be able to join Skype for Business Online meetings** - **Yes**, this is true. The coexistence mode for the R&D department is set to "TeamsOnly", which means they will only be able to use Microsoft Teams.

2. **Existing Skype for Business Online meetings scheduled by users in the HR department will migrate automatically to Microsoft Teams** - **No**, this is not true. The coexistence mode for the HR department is set to "SfbwithTeamsCollab and Meetings", which means they can use both Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams for meetings. The meetings won't migrate automatically to Teams.

3. **Users in the HR department will be able to make and receive PSTN calls by using Microsoft Teams** - **Yes**, this is true. 
Microsoft Teams is configured for PSTN calls, so users in the HR department will be able to make and receive these calls using Teams.
I assume it is not valid anymore. Coexistance mode is disabled by Micrososft.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/skypeforbusiness/audio-conferencing-in-office-365/setting-up-the-meeting-migration-service-mms
When you use the on-premises admin tools (either Move-CsUser or the Admin Control Panel) to move a user to the cloud, existing meetings are automatically moved to the cloud and converted to TeamsOnly. With mode=TeamsOnly or mode= SfBWithTeamsCollabAndMeetings.
On Test 29.03.22
Correct
NO | YES | NO

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your company uses Microsoft Skype for Business Online and Microsoft Teams.
All Skype for Business Online users can make and receive PSTN calls. Microsoft Teams is configured for PSTN calls.
You plan to upgrade the Skype for Business Online users to Microsoft Teams.
The Teams upgrade settings are configured as shown in the Teams upgrade exhibit. (Click the Teams upgrade tab.)
//IMG//

You apply TeamsUpgradePolicy to the user accounts of the company's R&D and human resources (HR) departments by using the coexistence modes shown in the following table.
//IMG//

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: No -
TeamsOnly: Can schedule meetings in Teams only, but can join Skype for Business or Teams meetings.

Box 2: Yes -
By default, when assigning either TeamsOnly or SfbWithTeamsCollabAndMeetings to an individual user, any existing Skype for Business meetings scheduled by that user for the future are converted to Teams meetings.

Box 3: No -
SfBWithTeamsCollabAndMeetings: Has the chat and calling functionality of user in SfBOnly mode.
SfBOnly: Can initiate chats and calls from Skype for Business only.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/migration-interop-guidance-for-teams-with-skype

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

In Microsoft Teams, you create a new private team named Team1 and add a user named User1 as a member.

User1 attempts to add members to Team1 and reports that approval is required.

You need to ensure that User1 can add members to Team 1 without requiring approval.

What should you do?

choices.A: Configure a new Microsoft Teams policy.
choices.C: Configure User1 as an owner of Team1.
choices.D: Assign the Teams Communications Support Specialist role to User1.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
correct
If the team is private, a member needs to request in order to invite a new member. Not true if it is a public team.

Selected Answer: C
agree answer is C.
correct

Selected Answer: C
Correct

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Microsoft Teams.

You have a team named Team1 that has the channels shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You plan to enable channel moderation for the channels.

Which channels support channel moderation?

comments.content: I think it was not. But when i check the teams client now you can clearly see a more limited Moderation setting there. Go check yourself. Hopefully this question is not in the exam.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Channel moderation is available for standard channels on Teams for desktop or web. It's not available for the general channel or private channels.

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/change-moderator-roles-and-settings-in-a-channel-6ac54758-3440-4f6a-9bd5-cebf97cb7ea6

Selected Answer: C
Channel moderation is a feature in Microsoft Teams that can be enabled for **Standard** channels.

this feature is **not available** for **General** channels and **Private** channels.

the correct answer is **C. Channel1 only**.

Selected Answer: C
Note: Channel moderation is available for standard channels on Teams for desktop or web. It's not available for the general channel or private channels.
https://support.microsoft.com/en-au/office/change-moderator-roles-and-settings-in-a-channel-in-microsoft-teams-6ac54758-3440-4f6a-9bd5-cebf97cb7ea6

I think the question is wrong. There is NO "General" type channel, channel types include Standard, Shared, and Private, but NOT "General". The default General channel has type Standard. And General channel does support channel moderation. So, if the question has correct General channel type Standrad, answer is A. Otherwise, chose C.
Channel moderation is possible for General and Standard Channels. Just tried from my end. Correct Answer - A

Channel moderation is available for standard channels on Teams for desktop or web. It's not available for the general channel or private channels.

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/change-moderator-roles-and-settings-in-a-channel-in-microsoft-teams-6ac54758-3440-4f6a-9bd5-cebf97cb7ea6

comments.content: Just try it. In my enviroment I cannot set moderation for default channel - named General.

I found this question is funny because I don't really know which is the correct answer. In my environment, I see Moderation options if I go to Teams client -> Teams in left pane -> ellipsis simbol at any General (default) channel -> Manage channel. But there is no "On/Off" option on this page as opposed to other standard channels.

What I really want to know is which is considered as "correct" answer in the real exam.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A.

The General channel on any Microsoft Teams workspace is a STANDARD channel (a "General" channel type does not exist) that allows limited moderation settings to be enabled. While you cannot assign any team members as moderators of the General channel, you can set it to "Teams owners only" and effectively achieve moderation. 

https://practical365.com/understanding-types-teams-channels/
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-channels-overview#channel-feature-comparison

Selected Answer: A
Tested on my own and General channel supports moderation

comments.content: In a limited way. It is different comparing to non-General channel. I would say it doesn't count as "supports"..

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Tested on my own. Channel moderation for general channels are available
El canal general que se crea por defecto con un equipo de Teams NO puede moderarse, no tiene esa opción para configurarse: No está disponible para el canal general ni para los canales privados.

Selected Answer: A
Geral e Chanel 1

Selected Answer: C
Correct

Selected Answer: A
General channel supports moderation

comments.content: Channel moderation is available for standard channels on Teams for desktop or web. It's not available for the general channel or private channels.
Try it for yourself. It is but it is limited to Team Owners only. You cannot add regular members as moderators in General, but you can certainly set it up.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Moderation is supported on General Channel

comments.content:
Channel moderation is available for standard channels on Teams for desktop or web. It's not available for the general channel or private channels.

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/change-moderator-roles-and-settings-in-a-channel-6ac54758-3440-4f6a-9bd5-cebf97cb7ea6

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct - You can create from an existing 0365 group/team, use the create a team option, or add a microsoft team link

comments.content:
i believe you are right:
When you create a new team from scratch, a new SharePoint site is created and connected to the team.
When you create a new team from an existing Microsoft 365 group, the team is connected to the SharePoint site associated with the group.
When you add Teams to an existing SharePoint site, that site is connected to the new team.
When you create a new private or shared channel, a new SharePoint site is created and connected to that channel.

discussion.content:
B. No

Creating a new team from an existing group or team in Microsoft Teams does not automatically connect it to a specific SharePoint site. The SharePoint site and the Teams team operate somewhat independently, even though they can be connected.

To meet your goal, you would need to create a new team in Teams directly from the existing SharePoint site. 

This way, the SharePoint site and the Teams team are connected. When a new channel is added to the team, a corresponding new folder is created in the SharePoint site's document library.

Answer is B.No. 
I thought A. first but got to know I was wrong as I tested it. 

When the team is created in the stated way, it does not have it show the content of the site. When the linking is initiated on Sharepoint site, the content is available on Teams.

Selected Answer: A
When you create a new team from an existing Microsoft 365 group, the team is connected to the SharePoint site associated with the group.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/SharePoint/teams-connected-sites

Selected Answer: B
B. No. The described solution does not ensure that a folder for the channel is automatically created on the Sales SharePoint team site. To achieve this goal, it would be necessary to create the team directly from the Sales SharePoint team site and select the "Create a SharePoint site" option during team creation. This will ensure that a folder is automatically created for each channel added to the team in Microsoft Teams.

comments.content:
The Teams client lets you create a Team from an Office 365 group

A SharePoint modern team site creates an Office 365 group automatically, hence this can be done

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/use-the-sharepoint-team-collaboration-site-template-75545757-36c3-46a7-beed-0aaa74f0401e

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I think, it´s not enough.

Selected Answer: B
It's not enough, You have to choose M365 group linked to SharePoint site

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that contains several Microsoft SharePoint Online sites.

You need to ensure that the content stored in a SharePoint modern team site named Sales is available from Microsoft Teams. The solution must ensure that when a new channel is added to a team, a folder for the channel is created in the Sales site.

Solution: From the Microsoft Teams client, you create a new team and select From a group or team.

Does this meet the goal?
